result.execSummary:
The defendant Don Earl Smith Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sale/Possess/Use/Transport Machine Guns, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.26(1g)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program AFTER SERVING 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence and concurrent to case 21CF2812

superMiscConds.notes: - Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both.

- No to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
- No to reside or be present where firearms is present in any vehicle.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Don Earl Smith Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Don Earl Smith Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Canfield in court for Don Earl Smith Jr.  Attorney Megan Newport in court for State of Wisconsin.  

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  


Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  


Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement Jarben C.

The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence and concurrent to case 21cf2812, credit for 250 DAYS time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
- Not to reside or be present where firearm is present in any vehicle.


- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 


*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program AFTER SERVING 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*Court denies expungement request.

Defendant Don Earl Smith (via Zoom) in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Don Earl Smith in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
BRANCH 15 for BRANCH 4.
  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court modifies bail to $5000.00 cash bail. 
All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Case adjourned to Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Branch 4 down on 5-11-2022. Parties contacted to reschedule hearing. Parties agree upon new court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Motion for Modification of Bail

Defendant Don Earl Smith in court by video with Attorney Jason Canfield who appears in person.  Defendant Don Earl Smith in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective D. Gaglione.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
